Channel crossings by migrants in small boats are on the rise
subhead: Since the beginning of the year, more than 20,000 men, women and children have managed to reach the United Kingdom – 7,000 more than during the same period in 2024. At least 15 people have died while attempting the crossing.

With 250th anniversary of US in 2026, Trump hopes to celebrate a selective history
subhead: A giant fair in downtown Washington, a mixed martial arts competition at the White House and a monument honoring national heroes: The American president plans to give the celebrations a resolutely patriotic tone, glossing over the darker chapters of the country's history.

headline: 'Negotiating with Donald Trump is like playing chess with a pigeon'
subhead: By torpedoing the fledgling 15% international corporate tax, the president of the United States has shattered hopes for a fairer world by only benefitting American multinationals, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

headline: The Swiss should drink more wine, says minister
subhead: While the government dutifully promotes public health, the minister of the economy and agriculture is expressing concern over the struggles of Switzerland's wine industry.

headline: From Rafah to Paris, Fadel Afana's journey as a psychiatrist in exile
subhead: A witness to the deterioration of mental health among the inhabitants of the Gaza Strip since 2008, the Palestinian practitioner arrived in Paris in October 2024. Thanks to the PAUSE program, he now works as part of a team of researchers from INSERM.

Frontex unlawfully shared thousands of people's personal data with European police
subhead: In the name of combating migrant smugglers, the European Union's border surveillance agency spent years collecting information on migrants and civil society activists deemed 'suspect,' before passing it on to Europol, the EU police cooperation agency.
byline: Apostolis Fotiadis,  Lola Hierro and  Ludek Stavinoha

headline: The relentless rush to build dams in China's Tiger Leaping Gorge: 'If we lose our land, we lose everything'
subhead: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (5/6). In the far southwest of China, plans to build massive reservoirs as part of hydroelectric dam projects have condemned dozens of mountain villages to disappear.

headline: Musk breaks with Trump and launches America Party, hoping to attract US voters frustrated by polarization
subhead: The billionaire, who was the main financial backer of the American president's campaign, has entered politics by striking at a sensitive chord: that of voters' expressed fatigue at the division of American political life into two irreconcilable camps.
